column5: I read your reports and they always and I mean always make me so very happy.  You guys are doing so well in your quest for fish this year... WELL done!  Cheers,  Jen

Great going. There are bigger ones out there Bly time will come and watch out  I love fall casting for the big ones,  Even having a boat in the fall I sometimes just go out of range where the peir casters are Drop the anchor and cast away from the boat. Hard to describe the power of a hit at high speed.  look forward to more posts and bigger fish
Nice Salmon!!! They are great fighters though the crowds can be too much at times!
nice fish cliff.i seen bly at the tackle store today she said she broke her rod fighting one of those brutes.beats carp fishing hands down keep those posts coming.
congrats on the pb, cliff.  you must have been stoked to hammer a hard-fightin' fresh one!  -d-

Wow...that's all I can say.  Bly and I headed out again tonight...me in search of my second salmon from shore and she awaiting her first.  We got there at around 8pm...the sun was going down and there were quite a lot of people around.  This time, I didn't bother experimenting with crank baits and went straight to tossing my spoon.  About 45 minutes in (exactly 24 hours since I hooked my first one last night), I have a HUGE hit.  Quickly set the hook and the fight is on!!!  This one took off on a few hard runs, but I felt a little more confident and thumbed the spool as she started to run towards some snags in the water.  I thought I had lost her at one point...the line went completely slack....so I started to reel as fast as I could.  Wouldn't you know it...she was almost right in front of me!!  She took off on a few more quick runs, but she couldn't escape the net!!  Here she is...a real beauty and my new personal best.  She measured in at 38" in length and came in at 18.5 pounds.  This also beats the current best for team 6!! We have a new entry in the OFC tourney.   After removing the hook, I looked in amazement...she completely destroyed the trebles and her teeth did a number on the paint.   I quickly replaced the trebles and started casting out again.  Apparently, my rod was no match for two powerful salmon as the tip broke off on my next cast out there.  We continued fishing...Bly had a few solid hits, but she was unlucky and didn't end up fighting one.  Her time will come...and you just know it...she'll beat my PB length by an inch and weight by a pound.  That's ok...I'm used to it now...between the two of us, she has the largest steelhead and walleye....LOL.  Anyhow....pretty tired...need sleep.  I'm still pumped.....
wtg! 2nights in a row. nice fish and congrats on new pb
Now you got me interested! Every OFNer is going to be shore fishing tomorrow  :w00t:

Well that's great Cliff, you continue to amaze me.  I'm sure its all beginners luck tho  That one is a real beaut, nice a silver.  C'mon Bly, get cracking, can't let Cliff be out in front for too long  Reel, MF, Reel.......  Joey

ok here we go folks last year it was monster walleyes and now we have monster salmon from these two!!!! I can hardly wait for next year to see what they pull out of the water!!  Congrats Cliff that is a beautiful fish!!
I have a feeling that Cliff's mugshot with salmon is going to be a daily feature for some time to come.  LOL.  WTG, Cliff!
Awesome Cliff! Two nice ones!!! You are going to have me out on shore now......  WTG on your PG too.   Bly's turn now!!
Cliff, you did make sure that's not a carp underneath that shinny cover, right? LOL  Congrats on the fish. Now, for us readers it's another 24 hours for the next report ;-)
I knew it, I just knew that you would be doing it again.  I also know that Bly will be definitely kicking your Excellent - good on you and good for you!
Well done Cliff but could you maybe leave some for us poor unfortunate boaters? -Brian
NICE 1 AGAIN BRO!!!
Wow Cliff.. NICE FISH...  WTG...
Well done Cliff...  I hope Bly gets a turn soon...  It poured rain all night so that should really get them moving in...
Nice fish Cliff !!! It will be hard to top that one.  Tight Lines
Great report and pic!... and Congrats on the PB!  I now have 2 dozen of those Blue/White spoons on order... incase the Salmoon should happen to migrate down here!
atta boy! Now go get one on a flyrod & really feel the power!
Well done Cliff...
A Monster has been created!!!!!!
Nice job! It sucks living in the east end. I have to wait until shore fishing at Bluffers heats up.

Thanks everyone....my goal this year was to catch one salmon that qualifies for an OFAH award.  This fish made it by a mere 2 inches.  If I dont catch another one this year, then I'll be very content with the successes I've already had....  now.....   I WANNA BIG MUSKIE!!!!!!! LOL
I told you it wouldn't be long before you broke your PB from the other night.  CONGRATS!!!  We'll see what we can do about the muskie when we get out.

Congrats Cliff and I'm sure your right - Bly is just letting your ego climb a bit so she can drop it that much further with her 40" 20lber tonight .  Hmm now I'm gonna have to learn all about this salmon shore fishing stuff - when's payday or as I now call it "give bass pro all my money day"?
The hobbit has finally found his precious. j/k lol.  Addictive ain't they.

Great stuff ccmt ....Jen and i hit Burlinton pier and Port Credit last night from 9:30 till 1ish never seen a fish caught ...1st time i have ever been to the Credit and never even seen a fish jump or even got 1 hit ....Guess i will wait to get them in the net for the Hatchery ...thanks for the report ...Fishmaster
Woohoo, grats man! Stop going there please, leave some salmon for the rest of us!!
